sequence_get_objects.htm+html.head.title: sequence_get_objects.htm+html.body.p:87-3
sequence_get_objects: With this function you can retrieve an array of all the object indices that have instances being created within the given sequence. You supply either the sequence object struct (as returned by the function sequence_create() or sequence_get()) or the sequence ID (as returned by the function layer_sequence_get_sequence() or from the sequence instance struct property sequence) and the function will return an array, where each item in the array is an object_index for the different objects being used by the sequence to create instances.

sequence_get_objects.htm+html.head.title: sequence_get_objects.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:102-9
sequence_get_objects: The sequence object struct or ID to get the objects from.

sequence_get_objects.htm+html.head.title: sequence_get_objects.htm+html.body.p:113-3
sequence_get_objects: The above code gets the struct for a sequence object and then retrieves the objects that it uses and stores the array in a variable.
